lexUnit.name: prattle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk at length in a foolish or inconsequential way.

sentence.text: ` Oh , Mrs Tremayne was pleasant enough , " she prattled away .
` That 's as may be , but not altogether relevant , " the diarist prattled .
Zeno had smiled and prattled cocktail-party talk .
She stood at the altar-steps , uncertain what to do as she watched her daughter try to put her arms round her priestly uncle , prattling all the while in infant Italian .
Like so many kindly , amiable people , he was a confirmed gossip and loved to prattle about his friends ' affairs .
` When you started prattling about that man I sometimes saw here before I ever went up to Oxford , " she said .
A Radio One disc jockey prattled in the background .
Stirling felt this inferred that he had loosely prattled at a cocktail party , whereas the gatherings referred to were private dinner parties .
The Colleen -- what a tiring girl she sounds -- prattled incessantly of horses .
“ If you 'd mentioned Pépin Le Bref , or Madame sans Géne , he 'd have prattled away for hours !
And the prospect of the world 's leaders prattling away while the Earth burns around them is a pretty gloomy one .
He was good with people : one day , when Madge trapped him outside the kiosk , Marie had been embarrassed hearing her prattle on .
` Like I was sayin' earlier , " she prattled on , ` yer gotta be so careful wiv kids . "
Flushed and eager , emboldened by fitzAlan 's smile , Ellen prattled on .
Of course you do , you have n't got an independent thought in your head , reflected Melissa crossly as Eleanor prattled on .
MENTION big-time tennis venues round here and folk let you prattle on about Wimbledon , Roland Garros , Flushing Meadow and Flinders Park and then press a few claims of their own .
Living in the moment , she drank her milk and began to prattle on about her visit to the dentist .
For the rest of the journey Maria prattled on about Bradford , but Ruth did not hear a word .
She prattled on to a background of the typewriter 's staccato rhythm : tests , screening , the pros and cons of home versus hospital confinement .
